mudServer
Class Player

java.lang.Object
  mudServer.Player

public class Player
extends java.lang.Object

The player is the cornerstone of the mud. Each player will have a set of stats, such as the player's name. Each will hold items as well. Each player will be responsible for sending and receiving messages to and from it's remote client.

Author:
Nemesis

getItem

public boolean getItem(java.lang.String itemName)
Gets an item from the room and places it in one of the player's hands. Returns false if the player does not have any free hands. Assumes that their is a matching item in the room.

Parameters:
itemName - The name of the item to be picked up.

dropItem

public boolean dropItem(java.lang.String itemName)
Removes an item form the player's hands and places it in the room. Returns true if successful, false if the player is not holding a matching item.

Parameters:
itemName - The item to be dropped.

movePlayer

public void movePlayer(java.lang.String thisDir)
Attempts to move the player to another room. Returns true on success, otherwise false.

Parameters:
thisDir - The direction to move in

isReady

public boolean isReady()
Returns if the client has sent a command to the server. True if the BufferedReader is ready, false otherwise.

Returns:
fromClient.ready()

recieveMessage

public java.lang.String recieveMessage()
Returns a message from the client. This method uses a safe algorithm in order to read from the BufferedReader. This is neccessary due to the fact that the readLine() method hangs.

Returns:
The received message.
